wikipedia_page.main: Robert "Rob" Dawber (8 January 1956 – 20 February 2001) was a British railwayman turned writer whose script for the film The Navigators was commissioned by director Ken Loach and shot in Sheffield, where Dawber lived. He was a long-standing member of the Trotskyist group the Alliance for Workers' Liberty.

response: The Navigators is a 2001 British film directed by Ken Loach with screenplay by Rob Dawber.
Rob Dawber received the 2001 BAFTA award (posthumously) for "New Writer" for the film.
*Rob Dawber (1956–2001) was scriptwriter for the Ken Loach film, The Navigators.
* Rob Dawber, screenwriter of Ken Loach's The Navigators, who was still a member when he died
*Rob Dawber, 45, British railwayman and writer (The Navigators), lung cancer caused by asbestos.
